Yes, striking the balance between privacy and security can be challenging, but it is essential to maintain a democratic society that protects individual rights while also safeguarding against national security threats. The DHS's use of advanced technologies for national security purposes while upholding privacy and civil liberties protections can serve as a model for other countries facing similar issues. 

Each country's situation is unique, so finding a balance that works best for them is crucial. However, it is essential that any measures taken to address national security concerns are done so in a transparent and accountable manner, with strong oversight and protections in place to ensure that they do not compromise individuals' fundamental rights.
